decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful Human creatures with disruptive abilities to quickly overwhelm opponents. By leveraging cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while boosting the power of your own creatures with Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively. The inclusion of Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat allows for quick deployment of creatures while ensuring mana efficiency. The deck's strength lies in its ability to rapidly build a threatening board presence and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base through land destruction cards like Stone Rain and Blood Moon, while accelerating its own mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. It also utilizes powerful midrange threats like Tireless Tracker, Inferno Titan, and Bloodbraid Elf to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Pia and Kiran Nalaar provide additional removal and reach, while planeswalkers like Nissa and Chandra offer long-term value. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through resource denial and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on using Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate mana and sacrifice artifacts to create a loop of abilities that allow for explosive combos, card draw, and mana ramping. By utilizing artifacts such as Terrarion, Ichor Wellspring, and Myr Retriever in combination with Scrap Trawler, players can generate large amounts of mana and card advantage to overwhelm opponents quickly. The deck also includes tools like Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb for removal and alternate win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces to dominate the game.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up quickly using cards like Farseek, Explore, and Sakura-Tribe Elder to get to the combo pieces of Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By ramping up mana and getting Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle on the field, the deck can deal massive amounts of damage by sacrificing lands and triggering Valakut's ability. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden burst of damage from the combo. The deck also includes removal and protection cards to help stall the game until the combo can be assembled.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures while utilizing mana ramp and disruption to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to accelerate your mana, while playing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly close out the game with powerful threats like Reality Smasher and Drowner of Hope, while leveraging cards like Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces of the combo.

The deck focuses on using hand disruption spells to control the opponent's resources while deploying aggressive threats such as Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf. It aims to lower its own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and capitalize on its abilities. The inclusion of cards like Grim Flayer and Liliana of the Veil help to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes a variety of efficient removal spells to deal with opposing threats, while leveraging cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald to ensure consistent access to its key pieces.

The focus of this deck is to quickly gain life through cards like Martyr of Sands and Serra Ascendant, while aggressively controlling the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of God. The deck aims to stabilize by recurring key creatures like Squadron Hawk and Martyr of Sands with cards such as Proclamation of Rebirth and Emeria, the Sky Ruin. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to finish the game in its favor. This deck thrives on gaining incremental advantage and overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Soulflayer to gain powerful abilities from creatures in the graveyard, such as haste, hexproof, double strike, and more. The deck includes a variety of creatures with strong abilities to be targeted by Soulflayer, as well as cards to help fill the graveyard quickly, such as Faithless Looting and Grisly Salvage. The goal is to quickly get Soulflayer onto the battlefield with powerful abilities, supported by aggressive creatures like Bomat Courier and Lotleth Troll to quickly defeat the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By playing fast and utilizing cards like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Goblin Guide, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for casting spells, while Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide additional direct damage or life gain. The deck also utilizes landfall triggers with cards like Searing Blaze and Grim Lavamancer to maximize damage output and control the board.

The deck focuses on early game aggression and efficient creature removal to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures with powerful abilities and burn spells, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of Mox Amber allows for faster mana acceleration, while cards like Lightning Helix and Lightning Bolt provide reach and removal options. The Boros colors provide a good mix of aggression and control, making the deck versatile in various matchups. The deck's aggressive nature aims to pressure the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to generate a fast and explosive start by quickly deploying a swarm of artifact creatures like Signal Pest, Vault Skirge, and Ornithopter. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck aims to power out early threats and equip them with Cranial Plating for massive damage. The deck also includes key finishers like Etched Champion and Arcbound Ravager to close out the game quickly. The deck prioritizes speed, efficiency, and overwhelming the opponent with a barrage of small but powerful creatures.

Utilizing a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and various artifacts, this Tezzerator Control deck aims to stall the opponent's board presence while digging for key combo pieces. The deck's win condition revolves around locking down the opponent with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Pithing Needle, while also generating card advantage with Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas and Search for Azcanta. By controlling the game's pace and limiting the opponent's options, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents in a methodical and strategic manner.

This UR Control deck focuses on disruption and resource denial through countering spells, removal, and land disruption. It utilizes cards like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Spreading Seas to control the pace of the game. Madcap Experiment paired with Platinum Emperion serves as a win condition that can shut down aggressive strategies. Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and additional control elements. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents by controlling the board, disrupting their strategy, and eventually closing out the game with its powerful finishers.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Street Wraith and Faithless Looting, in order to bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix for aggressive plays. Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore help to dig through your deck and discard cards for more graveyard shenanigans. Lingering Souls provides additional value with its flying tokens, while Lightning Bolt serves as removal or direct damage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and graveyard synergies.
